animals.name: Common Blackbird
animals.description: A medium-sized bird with an orange-yellow beak and eye-ring. The males are entirely black, while the females are dark brown.

animals.name: European Starling
animals.description: A medium-sized passerine bird with iridescent black plumage, which in winter shows a pattern of white spots.

animals.name: House Sparrow
animals.description: A small bird with a robust body, thick bill, and brown and gray feathers. Males have distinctive black bibs.

animals.name: Eurasian Magpie
animals.description: A striking bird with black and white plumage and a long tail. Known for its intelligence and loud, chattering calls.

animals.name: Yellow-legged Gull
animals.description: A large gull with a white body, gray wings, and a yellow bill with a red spot. Often seen near coastal areas.

animals.name: Feral Pigeon
animals.description: A common urban bird with a variety of plumage colors, though typically gray with iridescent feathers on the neck.

animals.name: Eurasian Collared Dove
animals.description: A medium-sized dove with a distinctive black neck collar. It has pale, sandy plumage and is commonly found in urban areas.

animals.name: Great Tit
animals.description: A small passerine bird with a distinctive black head, white cheeks, and a yellow underbelly with a black stripe.

animals.name: European Robin
animals.description: A small bird with an orange-red breast and face, brown upperparts, and a melodic song.

animals.name: Common Swift
animals.description: A fast-flying bird with a dark, sooty-brown body, long wings, and a short, forked tail. It spends most of its life in the air.

animals.name: Iberian Wolf
animals.description: The Iberian Wolf is a subspecies of the gray wolf found in the northwest of the Iberian Peninsula. It is slightly smaller than its northern relatives.

animals.name: Red Fox
animals.description: The Red Fox is a highly adaptable carnivore, with reddish-brown fur and a bushy tail. It is widespread across Portugal.

animals.name: European Rabbit
animals.description: The European Rabbit is a small mammal native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a key species in Portuguese ecosystems.

animals.name: Iberian Lynx
animals.description: The Iberian Lynx is one of the most endangered cats in the world, with distinctive tufts on its ears and a short tail. It is native to Portugal and Spain.
animals.dangerLevel: 3 (approach not recommended, can be dangerous if threatened)

animals.name: Wild Boar
animals.description: The Wild Boar is a large, omnivorous mammal found in the forests of Portugal. It has a bristly coat and is known for its tusks.
animals.dangerLevel: 4 (do not approach, can be very aggressive)

animals.name: Common Genet
animals.description: The Common Genet is a nocturnal mammal with a spotted coat and a long, ringed tail. It is commonly found in southern Portugal.

animals.name: European Hedgehog
animals.description: The European Hedgehog is a small mammal with a coat of spines. It is a common sight in gardens and forests across Portugal.

animals.name: Otter
animals.description: The Otter is a semi-aquatic mammal known for its playful behavior. It is commonly found in rivers and streams throughout Portugal.

animals.name: Iberian Mole
animals.description: The Iberian Mole is a small, burrowing mammal with a cylindrical body and velvety fur. It is native to the Iberian Peninsula.

animals.name: European Badger
animals.description: The European Badger is a burrowing mammal with a distinctive black and white striped face. It is common in forests and rural areas of Portugal.
animals.dangerLevel: 3 (do not approach, can be aggressive if cornered)

animals.name: Iberian Wall Lizard
animals.description: A small lizard with a slender body and a long tail, usually green or brown in color. It is commonly found in rocky areas and walls.

animals.name: Spanish Psammodromus
animals.description: A small, agile lizard with a rough, keeled texture on its scales. Typically found in shrublands and open forests.

animals.name: Large Psammodromus
animals.description: This lizard has a more robust build compared to its relatives, with a dark stripe running along each side of its body.

animals.name: Western Three-toed Skink
animals.description: A smooth-scaled lizard with a long, slender body and small, reduced limbs. It is commonly found in sandy soils and grassy areas.

animals.name: Iberian Worm Lizard
animals.description: A burrowing reptile that resembles a large earthworm, with a cylindrical body and no visible limbs. It lives underground.

animals.name: Ocellated Lizard
animals.description: One of the largest lizards in Europe, it has bright green scales with blue spots and a sturdy build. Found in open woodlands and scrublands.
animals.dangerLevel: 1 (caution advised, but generally safe to approach)

animals.name: Common Chameleon
animals.description: A reptile with a highly flexible body, capable of changing color. It has a long, sticky tongue used to catch insects.

animals.name: Viperine Water Snake
animals.description: A non-venomous snake with a viper-like appearance, often found near water bodies. It feeds primarily on fish and amphibians.
animals.dangerLevel: 1 (caution advised, but generally safe to approach)

animals.name: Ladder Snake
animals.description: A large, non-venomous snake with a distinctive ladder-like pattern along its back. It inhabits rocky areas and open countryside.
animals.dangerLevel: 1 (caution advised, but generally safe to approach)

animals.name: Lataste's Viper
animals.description: A venomous snake with a stout body and a characteristic upturned snout. It is typically found in rocky and mountainous regions.

animals.name: Mediterranean Fruit Fly
animals.description: A small insect with a yellowish body and brown markings on its wings. Known for its harmful effects on fruit crops.

animals.name: European Honeybee
animals.description: A vital pollinator with a fuzzy, amber-colored body and black stripes. Lives in large colonies and produces honey.

animals.name: Asian Tiger Mosquito
animals.description: A black and white striped mosquito known for being an aggressive daytime biter and a vector for various diseases.

animals.name: European Earwig
animals.description: A small insect with a flat, elongated body and distinctive pincers on the end of its abdomen. Nocturnal and often found in gardens.

animals.name: Housefly
animals.description: A common insect with a gray thorax, four dark longitudinal lines on the back, and a pair of red compound eyes.

animals.name: Common Wasp
animals.description: A social insect with yellow and black striped abdomen. Known for its painful sting and aggressive behavior when provoked.

animals.name: Green Lacewing
animals.description: A delicate insect with translucent green wings and golden eyes. Beneficial for controlling aphid populations.

animals.name: Ladybug
animals.description: A small beetle with a round, red body and black spots. Known for its role in controlling garden pests like aphids.

animals.name: Silverfish
animals.description: A small, wingless insect with a metallic sheen, known for its quick, darting movements and preference for damp environments.

animals.name: Carpenter Ant
animals.description: A large black ant species known for excavating wood to build its nests. Can be a structural pest in homes.

animals.name: Iberian Ribbed Newt
animals.description: A large newt with a distinctive ribbed body and a unique defense mechanism, ejecting its ribs through its skin.

animals.name: Fire Salamander
animals.description: A striking amphibian with black skin and bright yellow spots or stripes. It is often found in humid forest environments.

animals.name: Marbled Newt
animals.description: A medium-sized newt with marbled green and black patterns on its body. Males develop a crest during the breeding season.

animals.name: Iberian Painted Frog
animals.description: A small frog with a flat, elongated body and a distinctive pattern of dark spots on a light background.

animals.name: Common Midwife Toad
animals.description: A small toad known for its unique reproductive behavior, where males carry fertilized eggs on their back until they hatch.

animals.name: Natterjack Toad
animals.description: A small toad with a distinctive yellow line running down its back. It prefers sandy and open habitats.

animals.name: Iberian Tree Frog
animals.description: A small, bright green frog with a smooth body and sticky pads on its toes, allowing it to climb plants and trees.

animals.name: Iberian Spadefoot Toad
animals.description: A burrowing toad with a squat, rounded body and short legs, known for its ability to dig into the ground using a spade-like projection on its hind feet.

animals.name: Perez's Frog
animals.description: A common frog found in a wide variety of habitats, with a green or brownish body and a distinctive, loud croak.

animals.name: Western Spadefoot Toad
animals.description: A burrowing toad species with smooth skin, known for its rapid breeding in temporary pools of water.

animals.name: Atlantic Mackerel
animals.description: A fast-swimming fish with a sleek, streamlined body and striking blue-green stripes on its back. Commonly found in the North Atlantic.

animals.name: European Sardine
animals.description: A small, oily fish with silvery scales. It is abundant in the coastal waters of Portugal and often used in traditional dishes.

animals.name: Atlantic Cod
animals.description: A large fish with a distinctive barb on its chin. It has a brownish-green back with spots and a pale belly.

animals.name: European Hake
animals.description: A long-bodied fish with a silvery appearance. It is a popular catch in the waters around Portugal, often found in deep waters.

animals.name: Common Octopus
animals.description: A highly intelligent cephalopod known for its eight arms and ability to change color. It is commonly found along the Portuguese coast.

animals.name: Atlantic Salmon
animals.description: A migratory fish that spends most of its life in the ocean but returns to freshwater to spawn. It has a silvery body with a few dark spots.

animals.name: Common Dolphin
animals.description: A small, energetic dolphin species with a distinctive hourglass pattern on its sides. Commonly seen in the Atlantic waters off Portugal.

animals.name: Gilthead Seabream
animals.description: A prized fish with a robust body and a distinctive gold band between its eyes. Found in coastal waters and lagoons.

animals.name: Blue Shark
animals.description: A sleek, elongated shark with a deep blue coloration. Commonly found in the open waters off the coast of Portugal.

animals.name: Portuguese Man o' War
animals.description: A venomous marine organism with long tentacles. Though often mistaken for a jellyfish, it is actually a siphonophore.

animals.name: Domestic Cat
animals.description: A small, typically furry, carnivorous mammal known for its agility, affectionate nature, and independence.
animals.dangerLevel: 1 (generally safe to approach, but may scratch if threatened)

animals.name: Domestic Dog
animals.description: A loyal and intelligent companion, known for its variety of breeds, each with distinct characteristics.
animals.dangerLevel: 1 (generally safe to approach, but may bite if provoked)

animals.name: Rabbit
animals.description: A small mammal with long ears, soft fur, and a short, fluffy tail, often kept as a pet for its gentle nature.

animals.name: Guinea Pig
animals.description: A small, sociable rodent with a stout body, short legs, and no tail, known for its vocalizations and friendly disposition.

animals.name: Hamster
animals.description: A small, nocturnal rodent with cheek pouches for storing food, known for its playful and curious nature.

animals.name: Common Parakeet
animals.description: A small, colorful parrot native to Australia, commonly kept as a pet for its social and vocal behavior.

animals.name: Canary
animals.description: A small songbird with bright yellow feathers, known for its pleasant singing and lively temperament.

animals.name: Goldfish
animals.description: A small, ornamental freshwater fish with a distinctive orange-gold color, commonly kept in aquariums.

animals.name: Box Turtle
animals.description: A terrestrial turtle with a dome-shaped shell and hinged plastron, allowing it to close its shell tightly for protection.
animals.dangerLevel: 0 (generally safe to approach, but may bite if handled roughly)

animals.name: Chinchilla
animals.description: A small, nocturnal rodent with dense, soft fur, known for its playful and energetic personality, often kept as an exotic pet.

animals.name: Bigfoot
animals.description: A large, ape-like creature reported to inhabit the forests of North America. Bigfoot is typically described as being between 6 to 10 feet tall and covered in dark hair.

animals.name: Phantom
animals.description: A phantom, or ghost, is a spectral entity believed to be the spirit or soul of a deceased person. Phantoms are often depicted as translucent or shadowy figures and are said to haunt specific locations, typically where they had strong emotional ties or unresolved issues in life.

animals.name: Chupacabra
animals.description: A cryptid known for its vampire-like tendencies, allegedly attacking livestock and draining their blood. Descriptions vary, but it is often depicted as a reptilian creature with spines along its back.
animals.dangerLevel: 3 (caution advised, may be aggressive. If you are a goat, do not approach.)

animals.name: Kraken
animals.description: A legendary sea monster said to dwell off the coast of Norway and Greenland. The Kraken is often described as a giant squid capable of dragging ships and sailors to their doom.

animals.name: Alien
animals.description: A being from another planet. Why are they here? What do they want?

animals.name: Dragon
animals.description: A legendary serpent-like creature that appears in the mythology of many cultures. Dragons are often depicted as powerful beings capable of breathing fire and flying.

animals.name: Yeti
animals.description: A cryptid said to inhabit the Himalayan mountains. The Yeti, also known as the 'Abominable Snowman,' is typically described as a large, hairy, ape-like creature.

animals.name: Unicorn
animals.description: A legendary horse-like creature with a single large, spiraling horn on its forehead. The unicorn is a symbol of purity, grace, and magic.

animals.name: Mothman
animals.description: A mysterious creature reportedly seen in Point Pleasant, West Virginia. The Mothman is described as a large, winged creature with glowing red eyes, often associated with ominous events.

animals.name: Hodag
animals.description: A cryptid from American folklore, particularly in Wisconsin. The Hodag is said to be a large, fearsome creature with the head of an ox, the body of a bear, and the spines of a stegosaurus.

plants.name: Cork Oak
plants.description: The Cork Oak is a medium-sized, evergreen oak tree known for its thick, rugged bark that is harvested to produce cork.

plants.name: Portuguese Oak
plants.description: The Portuguese Oak is a deciduous or semi-evergreen oak tree that is native to the Iberian Peninsula, known for its durability and used in construction.

plants.name: Strawberry Tree
plants.description: The Strawberry Tree is an evergreen shrub or small tree that produces small, red, edible fruits that resemble strawberries.

plants.name: Stone Pine
plants.description: The Stone Pine is a large, umbrella-shaped tree that produces edible pine nuts, commonly used in Mediterranean cuisine.

plants.name: Holm Oak
plants.description: The Holm Oak is a large, evergreen oak tree with a dense canopy and acorns that are a crucial food source for wildlife.

plants.name: Maritime Pine
plants.description: The Maritime Pine is a tall, fast-growing tree widely used in the timber industry and for resin extraction.

plants.name: European Olive
plants.description: The European Olive tree is well known for its fruit, olives, and the oil extracted from them, which are staples in Mediterranean diets.

plants.name: Bay Laurel
plants.description: Bay Laurel is an aromatic evergreen tree or large shrub whose leaves are used as a culinary herb in cooking.

plants.name: Sweet Chestnut
plants.description: The Sweet Chestnut is a large, deciduous tree known for its edible chestnuts, which are a popular food in many cultures.

plants.name: Pyrenean Oak
plants.description: The Pyrenean Oak is a medium-sized deciduous tree native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula, often found in mixed forests.

plants.name: Laurel
plants.description: Laurel is an aromatic evergreen tree or large shrub with glossy leaves, commonly used as a culinary herb.

plants.name: Portuguese Fir
plants.description: Portuguese Fir is a coniferous tree with flat, needle-like leaves and is native to the mountainous regions of Portugal.

plants.name: Carob Tree
plants.description: The Carob Tree is an evergreen tree with dark brown pods that are used as a chocolate substitute and in various food products.

plants.name: European Ash
plants.description: The European Ash is a tall deciduous tree known for its compound leaves and smooth bark, often used in traditional medicine.

plants.name: Service Tree
plants.description: Service Tree is a deciduous tree with lobed leaves and small, apple-like fruits that are edible when fully ripe.

plants.name: Portuguese Laurel
plants.description: Portuguese Laurel is a dense, evergreen shrub or small tree with glossy leaves and small, white flowers.

plants.name: Mastic Tree
plants.description: The Mastic Tree is a small evergreen tree or shrub known for its resin, which is used in various culinary and medicinal applications.

plants.name: Wild Pear
plants.description: Wild Pear is a deciduous tree with small, hard fruits that are used in traditional culinary dishes when cooked.

plants.name: Monterey Pine
plants.description: Monterey Pine is a fast-growing coniferous tree widely planted for timber production in Portugal.

plants.name: Black Poplar
plants.description: The Black Poplar is a large deciduous tree with deeply furrowed bark and a spreading crown, commonly found along rivers and streams.

plants.name: Lavender
plants.description: Lavender is a fragrant shrub with narrow, gray-green leaves and dense spikes of purple flowers, commonly found in Mediterranean regions.

plants.name: Rosemary
plants.description: Rosemary is an evergreen shrub with needle-like leaves and blue flowers, widely used in cooking and as an ornamental plant.

plants.name: Poppy
plants.description: The Poppy is an annual flowering plant with bright red, delicate petals, often found in meadows and fields.

plants.name: Bee Orchid
plants.description: Bee Orchid is a small perennial plant with distinctive flowers that mimic the appearance of a bee, attracting pollinators.

plants.name: Purple Viper's Bugloss
plants.description: This plant is a biennial herb with striking purple-blue flowers and rough, hairy leaves, commonly found in fields and along roadsides.

plants.name: Common Thyme
plants.description: Common Thyme is a low-growing, woody perennial with small, fragrant leaves and pink or purple flowers, widely used in cooking.

plants.name: Iris
plants.description: Iris is a perennial plant with sword-like leaves and large, showy flowers in various colors, often found in gardens and wild meadows.

plants.name: Oleander
plants.description: Oleander is a highly toxic evergreen shrub with long, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of pink, white, or red flowers.

plants.name: Periwinkle
plants.description: Periwinkle is a creeping perennial with glossy green leaves and violet-blue flowers, often used as ground cover.

plants.name: Wild Garlic
plants.description: Wild Garlic is a bulbous perennial with broad leaves and clusters of white star-shaped flowers, known for its edible leaves and bulbs.

plants.name: Strawberry Tree Berry
plants.description: The Strawberry Tree Berry is a small, red fruit with a rough texture, produced by the Strawberry Tree, and is used in jams and liqueurs.

plants.name: Hawthorn Berry
plants.description: Hawthorn Berries are small, red fruits that grow on the Hawthorn tree, known for their use in traditional medicine.

plants.name: Blackberry
plants.description: Blackberries are dark purple-black aggregate fruits, commonly found in the wild and used in desserts and jams.

plants.name: Elderberry
plants.description: Elderberries are small, dark purple berries from the Elder tree, often used in syrups, wines, and medicinal products.

plants.name: Juniper Berry
plants.description: Juniper Berries are small, blue-purple fruits used as a spice in cooking, particularly in the production of gin.

plants.name: Bilberry
plants.description: Bilberries are small, blue-black berries similar to blueberries, often found in forests and heathlands.

plants.name: Sloe Berry
plants.description: Sloe Berries are small, dark purple fruits from the Blackthorn tree, traditionally used to make sloe gin.

plants.name: Rose Hip
plants.description: Rose Hips are the fruit of the wild rose bush, rich in vitamin C and often used in herbal teas and jams.

plants.name: Lingonberry
plants.description: Lingonberries are small, red berries similar to cranberries, commonly used in sauces and preserves.

plants.name: Crowberry
plants.description: Crowberries are small, black fruits found in heathlands and coastal areas, typically consumed by birds and other wildlife.
